nameEntry.part: Youth Legal Service Inc [Western Australia], Records

biogHist.abstract: Youth Legal Service Inc holds a limited number of records for clients who were aged 25 years or less when they accessed the service.
biogHist.p: While access to these records is restricted to protect the privacy of individuals, you are very welcome to enquire.
Youth Legal Service Inc holds a limited number of records for clients who were aged 25 years or less when they accessed the service.

list.item: Case files are generally held for 8-10 years after a client turns 18
Case files for clients with significant mental illness are held indefinitely

Case files for young people who were in out of home care when they became a YLS client are generally retained indefinitely. These files may also have background information from the government responsible for child welfare, and education records
Case files for young people who had multiple offences defended are generally retained indefinitely
Case files for Criminal Injuries Compensation cases may also have a lot of medical, educational and child welfare records included on the file.
